meanings.definition: In poor condition due to age or wear.
meanings.sent1: The old chair looked shabbier with each passing year.
meanings.sent2: The shabbier the house, the more work it needed.
meanings.sent3: The shabbier the umbrella, the more it liked to play hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: Her shabby shoes were a map of her adventures, each scuff a story.
meanings.sent5: The shabbier the book, the more cherished its pages seemed.

meanings.definition: Showing signs of neglect or disrepair.
meanings.sent1: The neglected garden grew shabbier as the weeks passed.
meanings.sent2: The shabbier the car, the louder its engine seemed to roar.
meanings.sent3: The shabbier the hat, the more it fancied itself a crown.
meanings.sent4: His shabby excuses were as transparent as glass.
meanings.sent5: The shabbier the sign, the more it blended into the background.
